page.title: 19INTERVIEW WITH FARMER
page.content: Mr Bettle farms 150 acres, has one 15 yr old small tractor which was Â£500 and a larger 5 yr old tractor which was Â£3000, both being second-hand. The dairy farm is over 100 yrs old. Mr Bettle has had it for 7 yrs. Rent per acre: 1920 was Â£20, 1985 is Â£70, now totalling Â£10,500 annually. Every day he starts milking his cows at 6:30am, at 8:30am has breakfast, cleans the yard and supervise jobs until 4:00pm, when cows are milked again. After supper at 6:30pm he does office work. Cows are kept inside October/January, graze outside in April, repairs done in May, silage for winter feed is cut in June/August, and calves are born and reared from July/October. Farmers' winter problems are keeping cattle fed and clearing snow from the drive enabling lorries to collect milk. {By Peter Hurford. Age 8.
